data.title: #TBT: In October 1970, the Nobel Foundation announced that NIMH-supported researcher Julius “Julie” Axelrod, Ph.D., had won the #NobelPrize...
data.meta_description: 101 likes, 14 comments - nimhgov on October 26, 2023: "#TBT: In October 1970, the Nobel Foundation announced that NIMH-supported researcher Julius “Julie” Axelrod, Ph.D., had won the #NobelPrize for discovering the reuptake mechanism of the synapse. His work provided an increased understanding of how the reuptake of neurotransmitters function, and prompted a field of research on the role of brain chemistry in psychiatry, forming the basis for current treatments for depression and anxiety disorders. Dr. Axelrod was the first NIMH intramural scientist and the second NIH intramural scientist to win a Nobel Prize. His effort began a tradition of award-winning NIMH research that continues to this day. #shareNIMH".
